intro: Lemyrea marojejyensis, commonly known as the Marojejy lemyrea, is a rare flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant is typically found in humid, shaded environments within the rainforests of the Marojejy National Park. Its limited distribution and unique morphology make it a subject of interest for botanists and conservationists. Due to habitat loss, it faces threats to its survival and is considered endangered.
